column4: why does a .php file, after a new install, attempt to get dled by FF and not run in the browser?
have you installed the php lib for apache?
if yes try this "sudo a2enmod php4" (if you have php5 then php5)
then restart apache
(sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart)
enable the php mod
I made a script and put it into rc.local
that is /etc/rc.local
a script ? hmmm
with all the iptable commands...
I believe so.. do you have any better place for it? :)
I do not have enough knowledge about linux to answer that question correctly

well just create file starting with #!/bin/bash put all the iptables commands you want.. and save it as <name>.sh use "chmod +x <name>.sh" to make it runnable and then edit /etc/rc.local and put the name of the file there (with complete path to the file)..
of course replace <name> with desired name :)
